Policy Description: Detected Disaster Recovery is enabled on this cluster - upgrading either the source or target cluster to AOS 7.3.0.5 may disrupt DR workflows
Discovery Message: The cluster **(Name: WC-KWA-NXA, UUID: 000581e3-76ec-96d8-0000-000000027cc9)** has Disaster recovery enabled.   Upgrading either the source or target cluster to AOS 7.3.0.5 may disrupt DR workflows, including protection, replication, and failovers, due to port 2020 being disabled by default.    Clusters with 0-RPO configured may also experience Stargate service instability after the upgrade.

Policy Description: Vulnerability in Supermicro BIOS Firmware (aka PKFAIL) can leave systems vulnerable to attacks that target Secure Boot or other vectors
Discovery Message: The BIOS version(s) **20.004** on the node(s) **WM247S002139** in Cluster **( Name: WC-WEY-NXA , UUID: 0005c575-5610-8b63-6cd3-3cecef5abbeb )** is exposed to the Vulnerabilities in Supermicro BIOS firmware. Supermicro platforms may use insecure Platform Keys (PK), which represent the Root of Trust (RoT) for BIOS. These insecure keys were generated by American Megatrends International (AMI) and supplied as a reference example to Supermicro. The impacted systems are vulnerable to attacks that target Secure Boot or other vectors impacted by a problematic Root of Trust.

Policy Description: NDB database engine and operating system version lifecycle support notice. Incompatible configuration may cause performance or stability issues
Discovery Message: NDB is aligning its database engine and operating system support matrix with each software vendor?s lifecycle policy, NDB will support a specific version for as long as it is supported by the vendor. This applies to all NDB qualified database engine and operating system versions.     * **CentOS 7.n is deprecated and no longer supported by NDB starting with the NDB 2.6 release.**     The below versions will be deprecated and **no longer supported by NDB** starting with the **NDB 2.7** release:    * RedHat 6.N & OEL 6.N    * SQL Server version 2008r2 and 2012     * Windows Server 2012 & Windows Server 2012 R2     * Debian 9.n & 10.n     * MongoDB version 4.x & 5.x     * MySQL version 5.6 & 5.7     * MariaDB version 5.5, 6.0 & 10.3.     Validate the Database, GuestOS and software versions managed by NDB Server **CGY-NDB-P01** on cluster **( Name: WC-CGY-NXE , UUID: 00061755-a6a5-3a82-390b-043201f0fd0a )** to ensure its compatibility with the NDB version. Incompatible configurations may cause performance or stability issues and will no longer be supported by Nutanix.

Policy Description: Cluster is configured to use a non-reliable NTP source
Discovery Message: Cluster **( Name: DR-AWS-NXA , UUID: 00062138-280a-23fc-d265-1cc0ae5e57ab )** is configured to use pool.ntp.org as a NTP source.  Pool.ntp.org is a community-based pool of timesources and should only be used for temporary testing purposes. It is not a reliable time source for production clusters. Please see the following statement from the nptpool.org website.   ```Consider if the NTP Pool is appropriate for your use. If business, organization or human life depends on having correct time or can be harmed by it being wrong, you shouldn't 'just get it off the internet'. The NTP Pool is generally very high quality, but it is a service run by volunteers in their spare time. Please talk to your equipment and service vendors about getting local and reliable service setup for you. See also our terms of service. We recommend time servers from Meinberg, but you can also find time servers from End Run, Spectracom and many others.```

Policy Description: Detected NC2 failures that may require administrator intervention
Discovery Message: The following Cluster **( Name: DR-AWS-NXA , UUID: 00062138-280a-23fc-d265-1cc0ae5e57ab )** is reporting unacknowledged failures in the NC2 console that may require manual intervention. Review the NC2 console notifications for more information     | Date | Type | Severity | Description | |----------|------|-----|-----|  | 2025-10-20	| CLOUD_PROVIDER_CONNECTION_ISSUES 	| ERROR	| System detected issues contacting AWS. Please refer to this KB article for more information: https://portal.nutanix.com/kb/9703 |

Policy Description: High memory usage may lead to CVM Out-of-Memory (OOM) conditions and cluster instability
Discovery Message: The cluster **( Name: DR-AWS-NXA , UUID: 00062138-280a-23fc-d265-1cc0ae5e57ab )** is currently running AOS version 7.0.1-5987da42. This AOS version is affected by an issue where system services can consume excessive memory, leading to CVM memory exhaustion. This condition can trigger out-of-memory (OOM) events, resulting in CVM crashes, restarts, or performance degradation, which may impact user workloads and cluster stability.
